     421             : 
     422             : // A 24 byte string class (can be as small as 17 for x64 and 13 for x86) that can hold strings with length
     423             : // of up to 23 chars on the stack before going on the heap - the last byte of the buffer is used for:
     424             : // - "is small" bit - the highest bit - if "0" then it is small - otherwise its "1" (128)
     425             : // - if small - capacity left before going on the heap - using the lowest 5 bits
     426             : // - if small - 2 bits are left unused - the second and third highest ones
     427             : // - if small - acts as a null terminator if strlen() is 23 (24 including the null terminator)
     428             : //              and the "is small" bit remains "0" ("as well as the capacity left") so its OK
     429             : // Idea taken from this lecture about the string implementation of facebook/folly - fbstring
     430             : // https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kPR8h4-qZdk
     431             : // TODO:
     432             : // - optimizations - like not deleting memory unnecessarily in operator= and etc.
     433             : // - resize/reserve/clear
     434             : // - substr
     435             : // - replace
     436             : // - back/front
     437             : // - iterator stuff
     438             : // - find & friends
     439             : // - push_back/pop_back
     440             : // - assign/insert/erase
     441             : // - relational operators as free functions - taking const char* as one of the params
     442             : class DOCTEST_INTERFACE String
     443             : {
     444             :     static const unsigned len  = 24;      //!OCLINT avoid private static members
     445             :     static const unsigned last = len - 1; //!OCLINT avoid private static members
     446             : 
     447             :     struct view // len should be more than sizeof(view) - because of the final byte for flags
     448             :     {
     449             :         char*    ptr;
     450             :         unsigned size;
     451             :         unsigned capacity;
     452             :     };
     453             : 
     454             :     union
     455             :     {
     456             :         char buf[len];
     457             :         view data;
     458             :     };
     459             : 
     460         525 :     bool isOnStack() const { return (buf[last] & 128) == 0; }
     461             :     void setOnHeap();
     462             :     void setLast(unsigned in = last);
     463             : 
     464             :     void copy(const String& other);
     465             : 
     466             : public:
     467             :     String();
     468             :     ~String();
     469             : 
     470             :     // cppcheck-suppress noExplicitConstructor
     471             :     String(const char* in);

     482             : 
     483             :     char  operator[](unsigned i) const;
     484             :     char& operator[](unsigned i);
     485             : 
     486             :     // the only functions I'm willing to leave in the interface - available for inlining
     487          15 :     const char* c_str() const { return const_cast<String*>(this)->c_str(); } // NOLINT
     488          15 :     char*       c_str() {
     489          15 :         if(isOnStack())
     490          12 :             return reinterpret_cast<char*>(buf);
